meanings.definition: A humorous imitation of something, typically a film or television show.
meanings.sent1: The comedy show featured a hilarious spoof of a popular movie.
meanings.sent2: The students made a spoof of their favorite TV series for a school project.
meanings.sent3: The spoof of the news broadcast had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: Her spoof of the famous actress was spot-on.
meanings.sent5: The spoof of the superhero movie was so funny, it became viral.

meanings.definition: A trick played on someone as a joke.
meanings.sent1: The prankster pulled a spoof on his friend by hiding his keys.
meanings.sent2: She fell for the classic spoof of the fake spider on her desk.
meanings.sent3: The spoof with the whoopee cushion never gets old.
meanings.sent4: His clever spoof made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent5: The spoof with the fake lottery ticket was a big hit at the office.

meanings.sent1: The comedian loves to spoof famous movie scenes in his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent2: They decided to spoof a popular song for their talent show performance.
meanings.sent3: She tried to spoof her friend's dance moves but ended up tripping.
meanings.sent4: The actor's ability to spoof different accents is impressive.
meanings.sent5: The group decided to spoof a famous painting for their art project.
